parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post information.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>True. The post explicitly mentions "candidates" participating in the parliamentary elections and refers to their controversial statements and actions. While it doesn't name specific candidates, it directly relates to individuals running for office.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True.  The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and the content is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few. The use of hashtags like #alegeriparlamentare (parliamentary elections) further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Potentially True. While the post presents itself as a news article analyzing candidates' controversial statements, the very act of highlighting these statements in a paid advertisement close to the election could be interpreted as influencing voters' opinions. The title itself is sensationalist and designed to attract attention.  The overall objective seems to be to inform the public about the candidates' behavior, but the method and timing could be seen as an attempt to sway public opinion.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post resembles a news article, presenting information about candidates' controversial statements. However, the context of a paid Facebook advertisement raises questions about its objectivity and journalistic integrity. The sensationalist title and the focus on negative aspects of candidates' behavior suggest a potential bias.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; rather, it presents information about candidates' actions and statements, which could be interpreted as influencing voters' choices.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>587821263743282</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post walks a fine line. It presents information about candidates' controversial statements, which could be considered newsworthy. However, the fact that this information is presented as a paid advertisement on Facebook, close to the election, raises concerns. The sensationalist title and the focus on negative aspects could be interpreted as an attempt to influence voters' opinions.  While the post doesn't explicitly endorse or oppose any candidate, the method of dissemination and the potential impact on voters' perceptions make it a borderline case.  In dubio pro reo, we lean towards considering it electoral propaganda.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>info-sud-est.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Info Sud-Est, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul postării 587821263743282, care, deși prezentând informații despre declarațiile controversate ale unor candidați la alegerile parlamentare, are un titlu senzaționalist și se concentrează pe aspecte negative, având potențialul de a influența votul alegătorilor.  Efectul electoral este potențial negativ pentru candidații menționați implicit, prin asocierea lor cu declarații controversate.  Publicarea acestei reclame plătite în apropierea alegerilor, cu un conținut care ar putea fi interpretat ca manipulare, constituie o încălcare a legii.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
